title: A Giant Factory Rises to Make a Product Filling Up the World: Plastic
summary: Royal Dutch Shell’s plant will produce more than a million tons of plastic, in the form of tiny pellets. Many in the Pittsburgh area see it as an economic engine, but others worry about long-term harm.

title: Saudi Aramco Says It’s ‘Ready’ for I.P.O. as It Reports Half-Year Earnings
summary: The oil giant’s chief financial officer said the timing of a public listing would depend on its “shareholder”: Saudi Arabia’s government.

title: Wall Street Slides on Heightened Anxiety Over the Trade War
summary: The market has been riddled with worry that the fallout from a costly trade conflict will undercut an already slowing global economy and hurt corporate profits.

title: As Saudis and Indians Grow Closer, a $15 Billion Deal Blooms
summary: Seeking new markets, the Arab kingdom plans to buy 20 percent of the oil-related businesses of India’s biggest company, Reliance Industries.

title: Stock Markets, Jolted by Economic Worry, Suffer 2nd Worst Drop of 2019
summary: Yields on United States government bonds fell, indicating lower expectations for growth and extending a drop that began as the trade war intensified.

title: Markets Are Shaken by New Signs of Global Economic Trouble
summary: Shares on Wall Street fell sharply after reports showed a slowdown in China and a contraction in Germany, partly reflecting the U.S. trade war’s impact.

title: They Supply the Garage, You Bring the Elbow Grease
summary: My Mechanics Place and similar businesses provide the bay, the lift and some tools, and ambitious do-it-yourselfers take care of the rest.

title: Trump Says He Will Raise Existing Tariffs on Chinese Goods to 30%
summary: The president said he would raise tariffs on $250 billion worth of Chinese imports to 30 percent and would start the next $300 billion at a rate of 15 percent.

title: S&P, Dow and Nasdaq Slide After China Tariff Threat and Trump Twitter Response
summary: Stocks fell to a fourth-straight weekly loss after Beijing vowed new tariffs on the U.S. and President Trump demanded that companies leave China.

title: Powell Highlights Fed’s Limits. Trump Labels Him an ‘Enemy’
summary: Fed Chair Jerome H. Powell says the central bank will do what it can to sustain the expansion

title: Nissan Got Rid of Carlos Ghosn. The Way It Did So May Prove Costly.
summary: The Japanese carmaker’s public accounting of its internal problems could provide a handy road map for lawyers seeking payback for investor losses.

title: A Windswept Plain, a Sea of Oil and a Mountain of Money
summary: A Chevron-led joint venture among several energy companies is spending billions of dollars in Kazakhstan to expand an oil field remarkable for its longevity, promise and risk.

title: Trump’s Methane Rule Rollback Divides Oil and Gas Industry
summary: A split between larger and smaller companies reflects at least tactical differences over the best course for producers in an age of climate concerns.

title: Will America Talk Itself Into a Recession? Trump’s Advisers Are Worried
summary: As consumers worry about trade, the president’s advisers worry about confidence.

title: How a Trump Tax Break to Help Poor Communities Became a Windfall for the Rich
summary: Opportunity zones were created as part of the Trump tax law to lure investment to distressed areas. But much of the money is fueling real-estate developments targeting the affluent.

title: At Saudi Aramco, Changes at the Top Point to a Coming I.P.O.
summary: A banker with ties to Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman is the new chairman. It’s another sign that the Saudi oil giant is preparing for a public offering.

title: China’s Pork Prices Soar, Adding to Beijing’s Troubles
summary: Chinese grocery bills were already rising because of the trade war. Officials are now calling for “an attitude of urgency.”

title: ‘Greenland Is Not for Sale’: Trump’s Talk of a Purchase Draws Derision
summary: Residents of the semiautonomous Danish territory were apoplectic, and Denmark gave a chilly reception to the president’s idea.

title: What ‘Victory’ Looks Like: A Journey Through Shattered Syria
summary: On an eight-day visit,  New York Times journalists given rare access to Syria found ruin, grief and generosity. What was missing after eight years of civil war? Young men and a middle class.

title: Hezbollah Says Drones That Crashed in Beirut Suburbs Came From Israel
summary: The incident added to tensions between the United States and its regional allies on one hand and Iran and the regional forces it back on the other.

title: Indonesia’s Capital Is Sinking, Polluted and Crowded. Its Leader Wants to Build a New One.
summary: President Joko Widodo proposed stripping Jakarta of its status as the country’s capital and relocating to the island of Borneo. Construction could begin as early as 2021.

title: At the End of a Chaotic G7 Meeting, Trump Changes His Tone on China and Iran. Again.
summary: The uncertain prospects for diplomatic initiatives with China and Iran was heightened by the president’s unpredictability throughout the weekend.

title: Huge Oil Spill in Land of Earthquakes, Tsunamis and Volcanoes
summary: The true size of the July spill, which has left an inky stain across 12 miles of shoreline and upended livelihoods in a dozen villages, is still unknown.

title: Saudi King Appoints a Son, Prince Abdulaziz, as Energy Minister
summary: Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman is the first member of the royal family to oversee the kingdom’s vital oil sector, part of a wider shake up of top energy-sector jobs.
